metadata.title: US ISO/RTO Electricity Supply Response Data — 2023
metadata.author: Bottlenecks Lab
metadata.notes: Capacity additions are gross nameplate MW reaching commercial operation in 2023, sourced from EIA-860M January 2026 vintage. Prices are 2023 annual averages from ISO market monitor reports. MISO, CAISO, and NYISO prices are estimates (marked with confidence field). Queue completion rates are cohort-based (not annual) and identical to the 2024 dataset.

isos.name: PJM Interconnection
isos.qualitative_note: Strong 2023 additions (7.9 GW) driven by gas CC cycle and solar. Prices $31/MWh. Capacity additions dropped to 4.1 GW in 2024 as queue congestion worsened. BRA 2025/26 at $269.92/MW-day signals the coming price shock.

sources.price: Monitoring Analytics 2023 PJM State of the Market (RT LW avg LMP, $31.08)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 3,487 / gas CC 3,355 / wind 594 / gas CT 380 / battery 60 MW)

isos.name: Electric Reliability Council of Texas
isos.qualitative_note: Energy-only market. 2023 prices elevated ($55.50/MWh) before massive 2024 buildout. Supply response in motion — 7.8 GW added in 2023, nearly doubling to ~14 GW in 2024.

sources.price: E3 2024 ERCOT Market Update (ERCOT North Hub DA avg, 2023)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 3,553 / battery 1,924 / wind 1,461 / gas 820 MW)

isos.name: California ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Battery storage buildout already substantial in 2023 (3 GW). Prices estimated ~$45/MWh DA energy-only (~$65 all-in less RA costs). Mandate-driven additions (SB 100).

sources.price: CAISO DMM 2023 Annual Report (~$65 all-in; energy-only estimated at ~$45/MWh)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (battery 3,052 / solar 2,545 / wind 95 MW)

isos.name: Midcontinent ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Solar buildout accelerating in 2023. Prices ~$35/MWh (RT estimate, ~$37 all-in minus ~$2 PRA). Capacity additions nearly doubled from 2023 to 2024.

sources.price: Potomac Economics 2023 MISO State of the Market (~$37 all-in minus ~$2 PRA, estimated)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 2,758 / wind 1,386 / gas 690 MW)

isos.name: Southwest Power Pool
isos.qualitative_note: Wind-dominated additions in 2023. Prices stable around $26/MWh. Large wind resource base keeps prices low despite modest queue throughput.

sources.price: SPP 2023 State of the Market Report (DA system avg)

isos.name: New York ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Prices estimated ~$45/MWh wholesale (~$58 all-in minus ~$8 ICAP; zonal avg estimate). Minimal new supply. Offshore wind procurement delays continue.

sources.price: Potomac Economics 2023 NYISO SOM (~$58 all-in; energy-only estimated at ~$45/MWh)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (wind 557 / solar 313 / battery 53 MW)

isos.name: ISO New England
isos.qualitative_note: Lower prices in 2023 ($36.82) than 2024 ($41.47) — 13% YoY increase. Minimal additions. Gas dependence + pipeline constraints drive winter spikes.

sources.price: ISO-NE IMM 2023 Annual Markets Report (DA avg, $36.82)
